indefinite.title: Temperature Override Mode
indefinite.description:
Choose how Home Assistant should handle temperature overrides.

**Important:** The Intuis system has a 12-hour maximum limit for manual temperature changes. After this time, your radiators will automatically return to the programmed schedule.

data_description.indefinite_mode:
When ENABLED: Home Assistant will automatically re-apply your temperature settings before they expire. Your radiators will maintain the temperature you set until you manually change it or switch back to schedule mode.

When DISABLED: Temperature overrides will follow Intuis behavior and return to the programmed schedule after the configured duration expires.

overrides.title: Override Durations & Temperatures
overrides.description: Configure the durations and temperatures for different override modes. These settings define how long each mode lasts and what temperature to use.

data_description.manual_duration: How long a manual temperature change lasts before returning to schedule (if indefinite mode is disabled).
data_description.away_duration: How long the away mode preset lasts.
data_description.boost_duration: How long the boost mode preset lasts.
data_description.away_temp: Target temperature when away mode is activated.
data_description.boost_temp: Target temperature when boost mode is activated.

energy.title: Energy Tracking
energy.description: Configure energy consumption tracking. You can optionally import historical data to populate your energy dashboard with past consumption.

data_description.energy_scale: How often to update energy consumption. Real-time options (5min, 30min, 1hour) fetch on every update. Daily fetches once per day.
data_description.import_history: Import past energy consumption data when the integration starts. This populates your energy dashboard with historical data.
data_description.history_days: Number of days of historical data to import. Larger values take longer to import.

reauth_confirm.title: Reauthenticate Intuis account
reauth_confirm.description: Credentials expired for {username}. Enter new password.
